projects.title: Linux System Hardening
projects.description: Comprehensive security hardening of Ubuntu Linux system following CIS benchmarks and security best practices
projects.long_description: Systematic security hardening project implementing defense-in-depth strategies including firewall configuration, privilege management, audit logging, and intrusion detection.

projects.title: Portfolio Website
projects.description: Built this portfolio website using React, TypeScript, and Supabase to showcase my cybersecurity projects and technical skills
projects.long_description: Full-stack portfolio website with dynamic content management, featuring responsive design, database integration, and modern web development practices.

projects.title: Home SOC Lab
projects.description: Designed and implemented a complete home security lab environment with centralized logging, real-time threat detection, and comprehensive security monitoring capabilities.
projects.long_description: Designed and implemented a complete home security lab environment with centralized logging, real-time threat detection, and comprehensive security monitoring capabilities.

project_documentation_steps.title: Configure Mandatory Access Control with AppArmor
project_documentation_steps.rationale: AppArmor provides mandatory access control (MAC) that restricts programs capabilities based on per-program profiles. This implements defense-in-depth by limiting what applications can access, even if compromised.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Verified AppArmor profiles loaded and enforcing via aa-status output showing all profiles in enforce mode. Tested profile enforcement by attempting restricted file access.

project_documentation_steps.title: Implement Automated Security Updates
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Automated security updates ensure critical vulnerabilities are patched promptly without manual intervention. This reduces the window of exposure to known exploits while maintaining system stability through tested security updates.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Confirmed unattended-upgrades service active via systemctl status. Reviewed /var/log/unattended-upgrades/unattended-upgrades.log showing successful automatic patch installations.

project_documentation_steps.title: Harden SSH Configuration
project_documentation_steps.rationale: SSH hardening prevents brute-force attacks and unauthorized access by disabling root login and password authentication. Key-based authentication provides stronger security through cryptographic verification.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Validated SSH configuration with "sshd -T" command. Tested authentication methods by confirming password authentication rejected and only SSH key access permitted.

project_documentation_steps.title: Configure UFW Firewall with Default Deny
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Uncomplicated Firewall (UFW) implements network-level access control following principle of least privilege. Default deny stance blocks all unauthorized inbound connections while allowing necessary services.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Confirmed firewall rules active via "ufw status verbose". Tested ruleset by scanning with nmap from external host, verified only SSH port accessible.

project_documentation_steps.title: Enable and Configure Auditd
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Auditd provides detailed logging of security-relevant events including file access, system calls, and authentication attempts. This creates an audit trail essential for forensics and compliance requirements.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Verified auditd service running and rules loaded via "auditctl -l". Generated test events and confirmed logs appearing in /var/log/audit/audit.log with proper tagging.

project_documentation_steps.title: Implement File Integrity Monitoring with AIDE
project_documentation_steps.rationale: AIDE (Advanced Intrusion Detection Environment) creates cryptographic checksums of critical system files to detect unauthorized modifications. This provides early warning of system compromise or configuration tampering.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Initialized AIDE database covering /bin, /sbin, /etc directories. Executed test check with "aide --check" confirming baseline established and change detection operational.

project_documentation_steps.title: Disable Unnecessary Services and Ports
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Reducing attack surface by disabling unused services eliminates potential entry points for attackers. Each running service represents code that could contain vulnerabilities or be misconfigured.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Reviewed enabled services via systemctl output. Confirmed CUPS printing and Avahi mDNS services disabled and not listening on network interfaces via netstat.

project_documentation_steps.title: Configure Kernel Security Parameters
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Kernel parameter hardening restricts access to sensitive system information and prevents information disclosure that aids attackers. These settings make exploitation more difficult by limiting kernel visibility.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Applied sysctl settings and verified persistence across reboot. Confirmed restricted dmesg access as non-root user and kernel pointer obfuscation via /proc/sys checks.

project_documentation_steps.title: Implement Password Policies with PAM
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Strong password policies enforced through PAM (Pluggable Authentication Modules) prevent weak passwords that are susceptible to brute-force attacks. Complexity requirements ensure passwords meet minimum security standards.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Updated pwquality configuration with 14-character minimum and complexity requirements. Tested enforcement by attempting weak password changes, confirmed policy rejection.

project_documentation_steps.title: Configure Fail2Ban Intrusion Prevention
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Fail2Ban monitors log files for malicious activity patterns and automatically blocks attacking IP addresses. This provides active defense against brute-force attacks and automated scanning attempts.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Enabled SSH jail with 5-attempt limit and 10-minute ban period. Validated by triggering failed authentication attempts, confirmed IP blocking via "fail2ban-client status sshd".

project_documentation_steps.title: Initialize React TypeScript Project with Vite
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Vite provides fast development experience with Hot Module Replacement and optimized production builds. TypeScript adds type safety that prevents runtime errors and improves code maintainability for professional portfolio presentation.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Verified Vite dev server running with HMR functional. Confirmed TypeScript compilation working without errors via npm run build.

project_documentation_steps.title: Configure Tailwind CSS for Styling
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Tailwind CSS enables rapid UI development with utility-first approach while maintaining consistent design system. This creates professional, responsive layouts without custom CSS overhead.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Tested Tailwind classes rendering correctly. Confirmed production build tree-shaking removes unused styles, validating optimal bundle size.

project_documentation_steps.title: Set Up Supabase Database Integration
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Supabase provides PostgreSQL database with real-time capabilities and built-in authentication. This enables dynamic content management for projects and documentation without backend infrastructure.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Validated Supabase client connection with test query. Confirmed environment variables loaded correctly and API calls returning expected data.

project_documentation_steps.title: Design Database Schema with RLS Policies
commands: CREATE TABLE projects with id, title, description, tech_stack, security_features
CREATE TABLE project_documentation_steps with project_id foreign key
ALTER TABLE projects ENABLE ROW LEVEL SECURITY
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Proper database schema design with normalized tables enables flexible content management. Row Level Security policies ensure data access control even though portfolio is public-facing.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Executed schema migrations successfully. Verified foreign key constraints and RLS policies active via Supabase dashboard.

project_documentation_steps.title: Build Reusable React Components
commands: Create Projects.tsx with card grid layout
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Component-based architecture promotes code reuse and maintainability. Each component has single responsibility making debugging and updates straightforward.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Tested component isolation and prop passing. Confirmed proper TypeScript interfaces prevent prop mismatches and improve developer experience.

project_documentation_steps.title: Implement Responsive Design
commands: Use Tailwind responsive prefixes (sm:, md:, lg:, xl:)
Test layouts at mobile (375px), tablet (768px), desktop (1440px)
Add CSS Grid for project cards with auto-fit minmax
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Responsive design ensures portfolio displays correctly across all devices. Mobile-first approach prioritizes performance and usability on constrained devices while progressively enhancing for larger screens.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Validated responsive breakpoints using browser DevTools. Tested navigation, card layouts, and typography scaling across device sizes.

project_documentation_steps.title: Optimize Performance and Build
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Production optimization reduces load times and improves user experience. Build analysis identifies large dependencies and opportunities for code splitting.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Confirmed production build completes without errors. Validated output bundle sizes reasonable with proper tree-shaking of unused Tailwind classes.

project_documentation_steps.title: Home SOC Lab (Active Deployment)
commands: The lab runs on an isolated 10.10.10.0/24 network behind pfSense. All systems route through the firewall before reaching internal services.
project_documentation_steps.rationale: I built and maintain a segmented home SOC lab to gain hands-on experience with SIEM deployment, endpoint telemetry, and detection troubleshooting.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: This is an active operational environment with real infrastructure and working telemetry pipelines. The lab demonstrates hands-on security operations and SIEM management skills.

project_documentation_steps.title: Current Infrastructure (Operational)
commands: Ubuntu Server 22.04 – Wazuh 4.14 Manager, Indexer, Dashboard
Ubuntu Endpoint – Active Wazuh agent reporting to SIEM
Kali Linux – Active Wazuh agent + attack simulation platform
Windows Server 2022 – Active Directory Domain Controller (domain: soc.lab)
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Complete operational infrastructure with network segmentation, SIEM deployment, and Active Directory services.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: All listed systems are deployed and operational. Network routing validated through pfSense. SIEM stack fully functional.

project_documentation_steps.title: What Is Working Right Now
commands: ✔ Wazuh Manager, Indexer, and Dashboard installed and operational
✔ OpenSearch security initialized and reconfigured after upgrade
✔ Inter-component authentication restored after upgrade issues
✔ Ubuntu and Kali agents actively reporting telemetry
✔ Active Directory deployed and DNS service records validated
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Endpoint logs from Linux systems are flowing into Wazuh and visible in the dashboard.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: All core SIEM components are operational with active telemetry ingestion from Linux endpoints. Security properly configured with TLS encryption.

project_documentation_steps.title: Troubleshooting & Upgrade Experience
commands: Rebuilt TLS certificates and admin keys
Validated service communication using curl and systemctl checks
Restored trust relationships between Manager, Indexer, and Dashboard
project_documentation_steps.rationale: During the original deployment (4.8) and later upgrade to 4.14: This required diagnosing service-level authentication and certificate issues across the SIEM stack.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: Real-world troubleshooting experience gained by resolving authentication failures, certificate trust issues, and inter-component communication problems during Wazuh upgrades.

project_documentation_steps.title: Next Phase (Planned)
commands: Install Wazuh agent on Windows Server
Deploy Sysmon for enhanced Windows telemetry
Tune alerts and reduce false positives
project_documentation_steps.rationale: Planned expansion to include Windows endpoint telemetry, network-based intrusion detection, and structured attack simulation.
project_documentation_steps.evidence_notes: These capabilities are planned for future implementation to expand the lab detection capabilities beyond the current Linux endpoint monitoring.
